title-group.article-title: The Impact of IFRS on the Amount of Audit Fees: The Case of the Large French Listed Companies

abstract.p: Listed French companies on European regulated markets were required to present their consolidated accounts using the International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS) from 1 January 2005. In this context, this study investigates the impact of the adoption of the accounting standards in France in 2005 on audit fees. The sample used in this paper is a panel of 69 French firms over a period of six years (2002-2007). Data were gathered from the SBF 250 index. After elimination for missing data, foreign companies, inactive companies or companies in the financial and real estate sector, the ending panel only consists of 414 firm year observations. The fixed effects regression results show that the transition to IFRS is associated with a significant increase in the amount of audit fees. This significant rise in audit fees occurred in 2004; it also was continued in 2005 but was not found during the post-IFRS period (2006-2007).
